attributes.title: Train Your Brain To Reflect Consciousness
attributes.description:
Today’s (16th April, 2015) Nithya Satsang on Ishavasya Upanishad in Living Advaita Series. Paramahamsa Nithyananda enters into 9th verse, in which Upanishad is giving us the powerful, important advise about not allowing boredom and tiredness, which is like hell-fire. We must raise the Buddhi, intellect to the next level and develop the subtle brain grooves to reflect the Pure Consciousness, powerfully, which is the only safe heaven for us; and which awakens the subtle intra-organ in us called Third Eye. The biggest challenge the humanity is going to face is boredom, as nothing will keep people excited. But, a man whose Buddhi, intellect is awakened never entertains boredom. He emphasizes on the need to make ourselves useful to us and to the world, aligning our body and intellect, and continuously explore the subtle truths of Consciousness

Isha Upanishad – Verse 9
andhaṁ tamaḥ praviśanti ye’avidyām upāsate |
tato bhūya iva te tamo yau vidyāyāṁ ratāḥ || 9 ||

Today’s Vakyartha Sadas, topic for spiritual explorations on truth is – How to be away from boredom? How we should not fall prey to “andham tamah praviśante ye’avidyām upāsate.” How to be away from worshipping ignorance (avidyām upasate). Don’t worship ignorance. How to be away from boredom? How not to worship ignorance.
